roleset.name: to cover completely or make imperceptible
roleset.note: DROWN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'drown' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from drown.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: For now , however , [the naysayers ' voices]-1 are drowned [*-1]by the roar of cement mixers and the clanging of construction cranes along the Strip .
example.arg: by the roar of cement mixers and the clanging of construction cranes along the Strip

roleset.name: to die or kill by submerging in water
roleset.note: DROWN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'drown' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from drown.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: It 's what 1 ) [*T*-3] explains why we are like , well , ourselves rather than Bo Jackson [*T*-4]; 2 ) [*T*-3] cautions that it [*EXP*-1] 's possible [*] to drown in a lake that [*T*-2] averages two feet deep ; and 3 ) [*T*-3] predicts that 10,000 monkeys placed [*] before 10,000 pianos would produce 1,118 publishable rock 'n' roll tunes .
example.arg: in a lake that [*T*-2] averages two feet deep

example.name: passive
example.text: When the Soviets announced [0] their last soldier had left Afghanistan in February [*T*-1], the voices of skepticism were all but drowned out by an international chorus of euphoria .
example.arg: by an international chorus of euphoria
